meanings.definition: The practice or condition of having only one wife at a time.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, monogynies are the norm, with a man having only one wife.
meanings.sent2: Monogynies promote stability in relationships by focusing on one partner at a time.
meanings.sent3: John joked that his forgetfulness was like monogynies, always sticking to one thing at a time.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was a form of monogynies, as she poured all her energy into it.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monogynies can be seen as a commitment to loyalty and exclusivity in marriage.

meanings.definition: The state of being monogamous in marriage.
meanings.sent1: Monogynies ensure a deep connection between partners in a marriage.
meanings.sent2: The couple's monogynies was evident in their unwavering devotion to each other.
meanings.sent3: The cat's loyalty to its favorite toy was like a form of monogynies, never straying to other toys.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the two friends was so strong, it resembled the monogynies found in marriage.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of monogynies lies in the exclusive love and commitment shared between spouses.
